      • surfaceCreated

        public void surfaceCreated(android.view.SurfaceHolder surfaceHolder)
        This is called immediately after the surface is first created. Implementations of this should start up whatever rendering code they desire. Note that only one thread can ever draw into a Surface, so you should not draw into the Surface here if your normal rendering will be in another thread. The user is required to call super on the base class
        Specified by:
        surfaceCreated in interface android.view.SurfaceHolder.Callback
        Parameters:
        surfaceHolder - SurfaceHolder: The SurfaceHolder whose surface is being created.

      • surfaceChanged

        public void surfaceChanged(android.view.SurfaceHolder surfaceHolder,
                           int format,
                           int width,
                           int height)
        This is called immediately after any structural changes (format or size) have been made to the surface. You should at this point update the imagery in the surface. This method is always called at least once, after surfaceCreated(SurfaceHolder). The user is required to call super on the base class
        Specified by:
        surfaceChanged in interface android.view.SurfaceHolder.Callback
        Parameters:
        surfaceHolder - SurfaceHolder: The SurfaceHolder whose surface has changed.
        format - int: The new PixelFormat of the surface.
        width - int: The new width of the surface.
        height - int: The new height of the surface.

      • getPlayerStatus

        public com.wowza.gocoder.sdk.support.status.WOWZStatus getPlayerStatus()

      • surfaceDestroyed

        public void surfaceDestroyed(android.view.SurfaceHolder surfaceHolder)
        This is called immediately before a surface is being destroyed. After returning from this call, you should no longer try to access this surface. If you have a rendering thread that directly accesses the surface, you must ensure that thread is no longer touching the Surface before returning from this function. The user is required to call super on the base class
        Specified by:
        surfaceDestroyed in interface android.view.SurfaceHolder.Callback
        Parameters:
        surfaceHolder - SurfaceHolder: The SurfaceHolder whose surface is being destroyed.

        Gets the volume level.
        Returns:
        The volume level, on a scale of 0.0 to 1.0.

      • setVolume

        public void setVolume(int volume)
        Sets the volume level.
        Parameters:
        volume - A value between 0 and 100 that specifies the volume level.

      • mute

        public void mute(boolean isMuted)
        Sets the player's audio track to mute.
        Parameters:
        isMuted - True to mute; false otherwise.

      • isMuted

        public boolean isMuted()
        Checks whether the player's audio track is muted.
        Returns:
        True if muted; false otherwise.

      • getScaleMode

        public int getScaleMode()
        Gets the view's video scaling mode.
        Returns:
        One of WOWZMediaConfig.FILL_VIEW or WOWZMediaConfig.RESIZE_TO_ASPECT (default).

      • setScaleMode

        public void setScaleMode(int scaleMode)
        Sets the view's video scaling mode.
        Parameters:
        scaleMode - One of WOWZMediaConfig.FILL_VIEW or WOWZMediaConfig.RESIZE_TO_ASPECT (default).

        Sets the logging level of the network messages during playback.

      • isReadyToPlay

        public boolean isReadyToPlay()
        Checks whether the player is in a state that allows playback to start.
        Returns:
        True if the player stopped or paused; false otherwise.

      • play

        public void play(WOWZPlayerConfig playerConfig,
                 WOWZPlayerStatusCallback statusCallback)
        Starts playback using the specified stream configuration. The onStatus() method of the status callback will be invoked with the state set to WOWZState.RUNNING when complete.
        Parameters:
        playerConfig - The stream configuration to use.

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stops playback. The onStatus() method of the status callback will be invoked with the state set to WOWZState.IDLE when complete.

      • stop

        public void stop(WOWZPlayerStatusCallback statusCallback)
        Stops playback. The onStatus() method of the status callback will be invoked with the state set to WOWZState.IDLE when complete.

        public WOWZStreamConfig getStreamConfig()

        Returns:

      • sendDataEvent

        public void sendDataEvent(WOWZDataScope eventScope,
                          java.lang.String eventName,
                          WOWZDataMap eventParams,
                          WOWZDataEvent.ResultCallback resultCallback)
        Sends a data event with the specified scope, name, parameters, and result callback.
        Parameters:
        eventScope - One of WOWZDataScope.STREAM or WOWZDataScope.MODULE, the scope to which the event applies. If eventScope is WOWZDataScope#STREAM, the resultCallback parameter must be null.
        eventName - The name of the event to send.
        eventParams - A name/value pair hash map of the event's parameters.
        resultCallback - An implementation of the WOWZDataEvent.ResultCallback interface whose WOWZDataEvent.ResultCallback#onWZDataEventResult method will be invoked upon receiving a resulting response from the server.

      • sendDataEvent

        public void sendDataEvent(WOWZDataScope eventScope,
                          java.lang.String eventName,
                          WOWZDataEvent.ResultCallback resultCallback)
        Sends a data event with the specified scope, name, and result callback.
        Parameters:
        eventScope - One of WOWZDataScope.STREAM or WOWZDataScope.MODULE, the scope to which the event applies. If eventScope is WOWZDataScope#STREAM, the resultCallback parameter must be null.
        eventName - The name of the event to send.
        resultCallback - An implementation of the WOWZDataEvent.ResultCallback interface whose WOWZDataEvent.ResultCallback#onWZDataEventResult method will be invoked upon receiving a resulting response from the server.

      • sendDataEvent

                          java.lang.String eventName,
                          WOWZDataMap eventParams)

        eventScope - One of WOWZDataScope.STREAM or WOWZDataScope.MODULE, the scope to which the event applies.
        eventName - The name of the event to send.
        eventParams - A name/value pair hash map of the event's parameters.

      • setShowAllNotificationsWhenBelowThreshold

        public void setShowAllNotificationsWhenBelowThreshold(boolean show)
        You can have the system notify you of each packet count when minimum threshold is met.
        Parameters:
        show - all packet counts while below minimum threshold.

      • setMinimumPacketThreshold

        public void setMinimumPacketThreshold(int threshold)
        You can modify the minimum threshold for when the PacketThresholdChangeListener is invoked.
        Parameters:
        threshold - Minimum threshold prior to notification.

      • registerPacketThresholdListener

        public void registerPacketThresholdListener(WOWZPlayerView.PacketThresholdChangeListener changeListener)
        Registers a packet notification listener to be invoked upon incoming packet count falling below the specified minimum threshold.
        Parameters:
        changeListener - The listener to be invoked upon said event occurring.

      • unregisterDataEventListener

                                        WOWZDataEvent.EventListener eventListener)
        Unregisters a data event listener.
        Parameters:
        eventName - The name of the event.
        eventListener - A previously registered data event listener.

      • getStreamStats

        public WOWZDataMap getStreamStats()

      • sendPingRequest

        public void sendPingRequest(WOWZDataEvent.ResultCallback resultCallback)
        Pings the server and returns the result to the specified callback. The result, in milliseconds, will be available in a responseTime property, present in the parameters sent to the resultCallback.
        Parameters:
        resultCallback - A callback to be invoked with the results of the request. The responseTime property of the result parameters passed to the callback contain the response time, in milliseconds.

      • setMaxSecondsOfAudioLatency

        public void setMaxSecondsOfAudioLatency(int numberOfSeconds)
        Sets in a range from 1 - 4 the number of seconds of latency that the audio buffer will allow until it dumps and resets on most recent incoming audio frames. It is recommended to leave this at the default of 3 as having some flexible time for sample-rate cross conversion is good or else you may hear glitches in audio when the buffer is flushed because of max headroom reached.
        Parameters:
        numberOfSeconds - 1 to 4, the number of seconds of latency that the audio buffer will allow
